The Humans of Tara - cast and crew featurette
Commentary by Tom Baker, Mary Tamm and Michael Hayes
The Humans of Tara - cast and crew featurette

notes: Fourth serial in season 16 of Doctor Who.
Part of the Key to Time story arc.
Inspired by The Prisoner of Zenda.
BBC interference prevented use of 'Zenda' or 'Zend' in the title.
Mary Tamm played multiple roles, Romana I, Princess Strella and their android doubles.
The story is a pastiche of The Prisoner of Zenda, adapting character names and plot.

in_universe_mythology: Tara society is a mix of feudal and futuristic elements.
Taran society developed advanced electronics and android creation due to past plague-induced labor shortages.
real_world_cultural_references: The Doctor saw Capablanca play Alekhine in chess 1927.
The plot was inspired by The Prisoner of Zenda and incorporates similar character names.

continuity_notes: Grendel returns in the prose 'The Trials of Tara', months after this story.
The Doctor previously searched for a Key to Time segment in Norfolk, 2011.
The Doctor and Romana encounter more androids in Bassett-on-Hample, Hampshire, 1929.

plot.plot_summary: The Fourth Doctor and Romana I arrive on the planet Tara to find the fourth segment of the Key to Time. Romana quickly identifies it, but Count Grendel of Gracht confiscates it, mistaking her for an android. The Doctor is recruited by Prince Reynart's party, who are embroiled in a political struggle with Grendel for the crown. The Doctor agrees to help repair an android copy of the Prince to help ascend the throne, but the real Prince is captured. The Doctor and his allies crown the android Reynart while Grendel holds the real Prince and Romana captive.

Grendel plans to kill the real King after marrying Romana, who he has captured, but the Doctor and his allies stop the ceremony. The Doctor engages Grendel in a duel, defeating him and forcing him into exile. The Doctor, Romana, and their allies are reunited with the fourth segment and the TARDIS.
